content.description: Alt Start to Geometry Class. Start deep in the cave on the shelf jugs about 10 ft right of the OG start. Make the first move into a shouldery gaston crimp and move left into Geo. An amazing variation that completely changes how you conquer the sloping mega-rail
Start matched on a jug, move out to sidepulls, make an awkward crux move out to a jug near the lip, and finish on the jug rail directly above. Top out, taking care of some choss.
content.protection: A few pads or just one with a great spotter
content.location: Just right of nemesis and memisis.

content.description: One move wonder. Located just to the right of the tree that is to the right of Geometry Class. Start with a low left sidepull crimp and an ever slightly higher right hand sidepull crimp in a wide compression. Pull on and slam out to a good hold in what is a surprisingly precise endeavor. There is a possible low start that would likely be lower double digits, but would also be an ass dragger.
content.protection: Two full pads, one small pad. You'll want a pad wrapped on the base of the tree.
content.location: It is easiest to find this route by heading straight towards the tree that has grown around the lip of the short cliff-band, and then walk up to its right side if you are facing away from the river. The climb also tops out to the right of the tree.

content.description: An excellent power climb. Starts on an obvious large rail. Pull through a Y shaped tufa hold and crimps to a slam dunk at the lip. Top out optional as it is usually wet.
content.location: Left of Geometry Class, Southernmost/leftside of the cliff band.

content.description: Start matched on the jugs furthest to the left in the cave. Move through a few moderate moves to a slopey crimp on the flat face of the boulder and go big for the lip.
content.protection: 3-4 pads. PUT A PAD ON THE TREE, IF YOU FALL ON THE CRUX YOU WILL LAND THERE
content.location: Far left on the 45 Wall, to the 20ft left of Nemesis.Look for the chalked up jugs.

content.description: What used to be a flowy V5 became much more committing when the hold in the middle of the horizontal roof broke clean off. Now, casual climbing flows through easy jugs into a pair of crimps and a big dyno past a 3 ft horizontal roof to the lip. Top out or drop off if the lip is wet.
content.location: In the middle of the wall, 5 ft right of Nemesis

content.description: The low start to Music theory V7-8  start low on undercling crimps, make a big move out to the start jug for Music Theory, and climb the rest of the boulder.
content.protection: 3-4 pads, put a pad on the tree, your going to fall there if you come off the crux.
content.location: Far left on the 45 wall, roughly 20ft left of Nemesis V4.

content.description: Start as for Galactic Commando by using a pad stack to reach small crimps on the right of the rail. Bust out right to a flat jug and then campus through to the jug shelf. The boulder was topped out originally, but dropping off from the jug shelf may be acceptable. The upper rock quality is somewhat less solid and is often wet for longer durations then the lower section.
content.location: Located between Mimesis and Geometry Class

content.description: One of the best V7s in all of Oklahoma. Starts under this huge sloped box-like rail in a large pocket on the left side. Work onto the sloped rail using heel hooks. Traverse over to a series of crimps and top out.Featured at 23:52https://vimeo.com/45830540
content.location: On the northernmost end, rightside of the short cliffband.

content.description: Use a pad stack to pull on to two small crimps furthest right on a rail. Traverse left and stick a tricky jump move before busting to the jug shelf.Either a hard 8 or an easy 9, more repeats should shed more light. A V12+ low start waits undone.The boulder was topped out originally, but dropping off from the jug shelf may be acceptable. The upper rock quality is somewhat less solid and is often wet for longer durations then the lower section.
content.location: Located between Mimesis and Geometry Class.

content.description:
Start hold is the obvious jug line. "Start far left before wave feature. Grab two small crimps and go big to the good holds directly up."

 Update (7/5/19) : Matt Desantis repeated it this past winter and downgraded it to V9/10 by going to a 3rd hold, a bad right hand sidepull before jumping to the top. The original Whiteside beta might not have used this hold which explains the significant downgrade.
content.location: Just a few feet left of Nemesis.

content.description: Hike toward the Power Wall, but instead the 45 Wall will be below you on the right.
